Data sets are a useful didactical tool for demontrating procedure of data analysis. For business audiences, business type data sets propose themselves. This post curates a list of data sets I find useful for this purpose.


- [Boston Housing](https://www.rdocumentation.org/packages/mlbench/versions/2.1-1/topics/BostonHousing) 
  - R package: MASS
  - [Data access](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/vincentarelbundock/Rdatasets/master/csv/MASS/Boston.csv)
  - [case study]()
- [NYC flights data](https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/nycflights13/index.html)
  - R package: nyflights13
  - [Data access](https://github.com/rich-iannone/so-many-pyspark-examples/blob/master/data-files/nycflights13.csv)
   - [case study]()
- [Wine Quality](http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/datasets/Wine+Quality)
  - R package: ???
  - [Data access - Red wine](http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/wine-quality/winequality-red.csv)
   - [case study]()
- [tiping data](https://vincentarelbundock.github.io/Rdatasets/doc/reshape2/tips.html)
  - R package: reshape2
  - [Data access](https://github.com/vincentarelbundock/Rdatasets/blob/master/csv/reshape2/tips.csv)
- [Diamonds](http://ggplot2.tidyverse.org/reference/diamonds.html)  
  - R package: ggplot2
  - [case study](https://rpubs.com/ameilij/EDA_lesson3)
